column9: text

Very much a mindless tap-fest, a game that looks stellar and plays super smooth but has no real strategy or thought process to it. Not that there's anything wrong with that, but it lacks the things that make classic Monopoly such a fun (if taxing, hah) game. Seems like a great way to kill a little time without getting involved in anything of major consequence.

Fun, very addicting. The building management system with monopoly is a great idea and it works really well as a multiplayer game. I'll change my review to 5 stars as soon as they stop pushing the ridiculous amount of ads constantly while playing and every time you open the app, everything is extremely overpriced as well. The same 2-3 ads pop up, and then half the screen is taken up by advertisment icons.

Too many popups. Popup close location is inconsistent and inconvenient - keep them at the bottom of the screen. Game quickly becomes redundant and boring. Playing with friends the "attacks" don't actually have any effect on the other player's account. The roll multipliers often aren't accurate. It has a nice design, but the gameplay needs more context and the UI needs more tweaking for playability. Roll regeneration is too slow.

Good game needs a few more options and graphical fixes. I would love to see a setting to change the speed that the piece moves around the board. The theatrics are cute but if I'm just trying to play the game on a break I would like the option to make that part faster. But I will say the dice in the game are very hard to follow and read, usually because of the characters walking around of the board please fix, I want to know how many spaces I'm moving.

It's mildly fun. I'm sticking with it a little longer but it has obvious issues. 3 popup ads Everytime you run out of rolls, constant tries to get you to buy in. The programming is obviously against players... You increase the multiplier, using more rolls each time, and you land on dead spots more times than not (free parking, community chest, etc). Basically, higher multiple means less or no wins at all. This happens over 90% of the time. It's clean, and repetitive.

The perfect Busy Person/ Mom game! You can put it down and away whenever, it doesn't force you to pay money for anything in order to level up and continue the game, there's no ads, and it doesn't get boring like a lot of games that meet the other criteria I listed usually do. The only thing I will say is I kinda wish your shield slots could be leveled up or something so you're not having to repair too often. But honestly I'm loving it so far. Already recommended to a few friends too.

I like it. It's not exactly like the classic monopoly per se, but still fun. I wouldn't mind playing this to kill some time lol. When you get to higher levels the only way to make money fast enough is by using the dice multiplier. Your dice run out faster but you get 5x the reward. Makes the game move a bit faster. If you want to play longer, just don't use the multiplier.

Meh. It's an ok game if you don't want to put any thought into something. All you do is pretty much mindlessly press buttons to roll, "attack" and upgrade preset worlds. You're not really building anything. For me it gets pretty dull really fast. Wish that there was more strategy. I.E. being able to choose to help a friend rather than attack. Choosing one or the other nets different prizes. Building world's that gather income by how many friends/people visit, etc etc.

A pay to win in it's full definition. The "friend" mechanic is useless, it relies heavily on the use of external apps to request 'stickers' that are used in-game. It is difficult to keep up your progress of you don't throw out your money. The idea is interesting, but still needs to be developed a lot! Finally, do not install if you are looking for something like the traditional Monopoly, The only thing in common is the name.

Not really Monopoly, just another boring no skill/strategy tap game. Sure the board is there, but you start off owning all the properties on the board. And you collect the rent money when you land on a property. Very backwards from the original. Instead of buying properties on the board, you buy properties in various cities you travel to. The only point of the board is to collect money as you go around. And then there are a few mini games to collect even more money. All designed to make u pay $

I'm giving it 2 stars only because I love monopoly. The game could use some improvements for example once you're done building a landmark it should no longer be available to be shutdown. It's very frustrating to keep rebuilding especially without shields or rolls to continue playing. 2nd...why is it that you don't get free rolls when you roll doubles like on the board game? That needs to change. Why a whole hour to get more rolls? That's a headache too. Do better please!!

Very hard to level up, you don't get enough dice, not enough coins, you have to use your coins to "fix" your buildings while trying to upgrade them without being able to accomplish that before you run out of dice. There are better monopoly games out there. Board kings is a similar concept and a better game than this. You can only play a couple of minutes, and you're out of rolls. You can't even play when you want to so what's the point

This game is similar to Board Kings, but it's way better. The developers are super generous; I get lots of rolls often, which allows me to play for longer, which allows me to enjoy the game even more. The heists and demolition mini games are also a neat feature. I would like it if you could increase the graphics in the settings menu. Other than that, this is a great game, and I'm looking forward to future updates that the game has to offer!

So far I really like the game but I have a few things about the game that's a bit frustrating. For one, the pop ups of always asking to spend money to buy dice and add friends. Sometimes you want to just enjoy a game without always having to spend money to move forward. Waiting almost 1 hour to get another set of dice makes you don't want to play..I saw a review of a person who had an idea of looking at an ad to retrieve more dice, or play a mini game to earn more dice. That would be great!!

Really fun game and it stays fun. It doesn't get to an impossible stage like most games after playing and getting interested you can't get enough energy, coins, etc to advance in the games. So far I am happy with the game and it has bn fair. Best part is not a bunch of ads. I know ads are what makes it possible to be free and I appreciate it but when they more ads than you can pay the game it's a game changer for me.

It had been an Interesting diversion but it has alot it can do to make it better. Everytime you open it the same ads pop up repeatedly and take ages to click through the game needs a better trade feature to prevent scamming since it's too easy to just send something and not reciprocate (as long as they give an option for nothing if someone's giving a freebie) and it'd help if knowing when you can trade again was indicated. Dice is too slow to re accumulate as well. 5 per an hour is pitiful regen

The concept of Monopoly Go is fun and inviting. It's easy to learn and play and a nice game to play for short periods. That's why it gets 2 stars and not 1 because the money grabs that this game employs is atrocious. As soon as you open up the game, you'll get at least 3 pop-ups asking for your money. These then return to the side of the screen and take up a significant amount of space. But, every time you run low on money or dice, you're getting all the pop-ups again. Truly shameless.

Nice graphics, seems pretty easy. I like that I only have to check in with it for a few minutes a couple times a day. I wish I could go back to look at the other maps, and maybe there would be something to do there like collect rent from the buildings on past maps or something. Also I can't get the app to login with Google Play Games, tapping "sign in with Google" doesn't do anything.

It's very similar to other dice building games, but with a Monopoly skin. I dislike how so many of these apps rely on Facebook, which has fallen out of favor. The ads are intrusive and the gameplay is repetitive. But it does look nice and it's simple and easy to learn and upgrade, if you enjoy the looping games like this.

Update after playing. I had high hopes in the beginning. But the dice respond rate takes too long, and pop-ups to buy stuff are shoved in your face too much. After the first few cities, it's basically a crawl to build and upgrade. It kills the fun of the game real quickly. I'll change back to 5 stars if things improve. But for now, it's just another cash grab focused game.

I went in thinking that this was a mobile version of an actual monopoly game that I could play with bots offline. While it wasn't what I expected, I did enjoy the nice time of building my empire while doing it small steps at a time. It's a clever little game that doesn't demand much, and payments to continue playing are completely optional to continue winning unlike most other apps these days.

I love the game but it has one small problem. Whenever I try to switch opponents the screen it goes to shows no targets in shutdown and there's no way to exit the screen! I had to completely close out the game and reboot it to get out of that screen! How am I supposed to take revenge on an opponent if there's no targets to aim for and no way to exit the screen? Plus I have no choice but to go after a random player. Fix it and I'll rate 5 stars.

This game is definitely not Monopoly, but rather a game that takes place within the Monopoly universe. Its a decent timekiller, but there are some pretty big issues that make me concerned for its future. The constant reminders to connect to Facebook. Three popup notifications for microtransactions every time you run out of dice (all of which have their close button in a different place, all of which have a buy button where another ones close button is) App notifications that are blatantly wrong

This really is a great app (at least for games). I can't speak to the issues others have had with surveys. The only issue I've had is some credits not being given.l, but it's easy to full out a ticket to get credit. They probably have the best customer service of any "play to earn" app that I have used.

Not monopoly, not really, sure you roll dice to move around a board but there is absolutely no strategy. You go around the board it auto does its stuff to get you some money then you can build up predetermined parts of a city in a fairly useless matter, then it constantly attacks you with pop ups to keep spending more money for more rolls or money to upgrade more... for no reason. I may be missing something but I have found no actual point to this game.

I'm really loving this game! 4 stars because 5 rolls per hour is nowhere near enough. It's one of those things that could be a deathblow to the game if not raised to a higher amount. I've seen too many mobile games fall due to a fix so simple but overlooked. *EDIT* I had to Uninstall because the game slows down around the 7th world cause the amount of rolls are extremely tight and usually hit a brick wall cause it's rinse and repeat. Get rolls, almost enough to upgrade, someone steals it. 2 star

I have found this game very enjoyable and fun to play. Just a few issues such as me inviting two friends to the game that accepted using the link but the game never acknowledging that that happened (the game gives rewards for getting people to play the game). I also really really don't like the amount of time it takes for the dice to reload. I understand that there has to be some wait but an hour just to get five dice? I love this game but its stuff like that that makes me lose interest.

It looks great and so far it runs smooth. I wish it was more integrated with Facebook. I hate bothering my friends with actual messages just to invite them to the game. Because of that I won't invite anyone because I know how annoying it is. I also dislike the constant pop ups to spend money. All it does is make me not want to play instead of spending money.

This game would be awesome if it wasn't so glitchy. It seems like every time I do a bank heist and hit big, the game freezes. I get the loot, but I have to close the game and reopen it and the "no internet" warning is also a pain in the arse when it's unwarranted. Please fix the bugs and I will keep the game. Otherwise it's not much fun when you're on a "roll" and you have to shut it down because of the bugs.

It's exactly the old tried and true winner. Monopoly is fun and if I had to give ANY constructive criticism being a writer, I'd have to say there could be more bells and whistles.... without going overboard, you could also give more character to each different area (color)it just seems like a roll roll roll to what. Sometimes people don't want to overthink it, and I don't see anything wrong with that, but to definitely level it up, clearly demonstrate that you can win tangible rewards.gift cards

Hi, I'm updating the review from last time. The game is good, but I don't think the progress meter for inviting friends is working. I have invited like 3-4 people and the bar is not moving at all. Please fix this it is the only issue i have with this game. Will keep 5 stars if the issue can be resolved quickly. Re updating- I have invited several friends that haven't played the game and still no progress on the meter. Kinda stinks,but other than that,it's good. Would be nice if that worked out.

Game is a fun idle game to play. However, when you are out of rolls, you have to click through 3+ adds asking if you want to buy more rolls which is incredibly annoying. This becomes even worse when you already denied the three adds, then a friend gifts you 10 rolls and then you have three adds again. Ridiculous. I would give 5 stars but this really lowers the experience

Boring to play, at least you begin with money and lots of dices, but then you'll reach a point where you lost everything and don't have enough for keep playing. Also, it's the pop-ups problem, the game constantly show you big amounts of this, trying to convince you to spend money on it but, why? It's not necessary at all. Furthermore, the mechanics, nothing brand new, different than other "idle" games. I tried to connect with my Google/Facebook account to the game to link but is locked.

I do love this game It is very fun to play however running out of dice too soon you should have an option to watch videos for more dice... Also I never leave a review on games but I feel like you need to know that when you try to switch opponents to mess up somebody else's board sometimes it glitches and won't let you do anything and I have to close out the game and then reopen it also the notifications that's popping up across the screen on the game while you're playing is annoying

Decent game absolutely ruined by pop-ups. Its also not a go title, as the maps are pre generated boards. Log in, 3 forced pop-ups. Run out of money or rolls: 3 forced pop-ups. Its predatory as F. Also, you cannot disable notifications in game, you have to do it in your phones settings. Once you do, the option magically appears in game to re-enable them.

"Board Kings" with a Monopoly skin. Absolutely playable without spending real money. Sure there's pop-ups that try to make you spend real money but you can tap the X on each to clear them. This is how many "free" games make their money, by Micro transactions. Looking forward to the future of this game and how things will be kept exciting.
column11: Hi there! It’s always a pleasure to hear that our effort has created a satisfying experience for a Monopoly enthusiast. Reading your review, we understand that we still have hurdles to overcome which is something we are definitely aiming to resolve. Feel free to reach out and let us know of any additional changes you would like to see.

column9: It would be fun if it weren't for all the ads. Anytime you start the game, you will get 4-6 pop-ups, and those same pop-ups all come up again when you run out of dice. Once a day is fine, but it's overkill, and becomes very annoying very quickly. If you want me to spend money, just show me the ad once, and then I'll decide. By rubbing it in my face constantly, you make me actively decide to not spend money.

Will update review later. Okay game to pass by time but has an overwhelming amount of pop up ads trying to get you to buy more dice rolls it's insane. Problem is the first map is the same map as the rest. It's just upgrading the same 5 building sover and over and over. It feels like you accomplished nothing but waste of your time and life. It clearly feels like a quick cash grab effort for those dumb enough to buy additional rolls to rebuild the same things over and over.

The game doesn't let you choose which properties you buy. Instead it automatically places the buildings around the board. Without this aspect of Monopoly, there's no skill or thought involved in moves. You tap to roll the dice, collect money and add buildings in different cities. Once all the buildings are upgraded, you move on. Chances to steal from other boards. Not like the board game at all. 2 stars for game play. Gave 3rd star as the graphics looks great. Bored already though. Uninstalled.

Boring. There's no unique progression. Everyone that plays this game will go through the exact same steps. You collect dice, travel around the board where mostly nothing happens except you collect money from landing on each space. Then with the cash you collected, you build 5 predetermined buildings, and upgrade each one 3 times. This "completes" the board and then you move on to a new board and repeat. There's nothing to it. Everyone builds the exact same 5 buildings in the exact same place.

Needs more things to become more attractive. Everything is based on luck and randomness. There should be something that distinguishes players. Tournaments are very good idea. Why not have a tournament between friends too? Animations are excellent. The amount of rolls per hour is very little, forcing a user to always pay for rolls if he want to play more, that is not good.

Graphics and animation are great but the screen is cluttered by icons for offers/events and the number of pop-up "nag" screens is insane. I've given it quite a bit of time but it's incredibly repetitive... even the changing boards offer very little, just new "landmarks" to build up that you don't really spend any time with and cost more each board making it very grindy... probably better off playing actual Monopoly

Absolute garbage. Original concept ripped from Coin Master. Gain money, upgrade buildings, go to sleep and wake up with your building wrecked which you then have to pay for to fix before you can continue upgrading. The money gained after initial install isn't enough to get passed level 2. Uninstalled, won't be playing anymore. I gave it a chance after reading the many many negative reviews and I now understand why there is so many. It's pay to play, simple as that, I won't be spending a penny!!

Good game. Keeps me rolling. Not like your usual Monopoly. The money pop ups get annoying. They pop up when opening the app. Again when you can't roll your multiplayer and again when completely out of dice. To refill your dice takes all day the kor you get. Don't seem to see any function to swap stickers with people and swapping 100 stars for the chest is pants. I do also notice, whenn you need to land on certain squares, you never get them like free parking! Overall, the game is good. Not great

The game is quite entertaining, and I like it since there are no ads. However, one issue I have is that I get notifications suggesting that my rolls are full, but when I enter the game, they aren't. Additionally, the popups are repetitive. I have to close them every time I launch the game or run out of rolls. I wish you can offer a "Do not show again (for a day)" option because we can always open the game store to purchase more rolls and money. Thank you! I hope one or both will be resolved.

The good - The game has a really good interface and pleasant graphics. The bad - The game has an extremely repetitive gameplay loop. You roll the dice or auto-roll them, earning money depending on where you land. More rarely, you will attack another player, which involves tapping a target once and then quickly going back to your board. They up-sell everything in this game with intrusive pop ups. To conclude, the game lacks any real depth and is pay to win. What you win isn't clear, though.

Great game play, but the pop-ups are infuriating. If I didn't want to buy more rolls or packages at the start of the game, I'm not going to want them at any other point either, and if I so, I'll go looking for them. Suggest a 'don't show me this again button' even if it's just good for that use of the game and you have to select it again the following time you play, it'd be better than getting the same pop ups (up to 7 in a row sometimes!) Every time you get low on dice.

The game looks polished and vibrant on the outside, and runs very smoothly but that's where the pros end. The amount of popups asking you to spend money every few seconds make the game difficult to enjoy. Besides, there's really no change in the game mechanics or play style. There's no true growth in this game as all you ever do is press the roll dice button, then spend money to make your buildings look different. Progressing through the levels doesn't give any sense of accomplishment.

A simple game with lots of different aspects. It's a board game, build game, knock down game and a match 3 game amongst other things. It's fun biggest downside? It takes so long to regenerate the dice needed to play meaning I can play twice a day at best and even then without a full load of dice. This needs to change before I get bored waiting to play

Utterly terrible. There is a board; there are two dices; and there ends the Monopoly resemblance. Blatant cash grab, with no strategy or fun minigames. Click the button to collect ressources and give us money to click the button some more. So much potential, so little results. I don't even wish for my ennemies to become addicted to this! If you want to waste money, there are much better games to do so.

This game is Great! The game play is fun and quarky, easy to follow. I am however removing one star because of the ammount of ads that pop up and interrupt game play. Most games have daily ads that pop up once. This game has a minimum of three that pop up EVERY time you run out of dice, and every time you log in. This is something the development team should work on.

Visually what it says on the box and no actual Monopoly involved. There's no actual progression and nothing to aim towards, and there's annoyingly regular pop-ups to spend money. Spend money on what? This is basically a cartoon idler that is oriented towards completing buildings that vaguely remind you of landmarks of different cities.

The game is very enjoyable and keeps itself fresh with renewed houses and hotels on each tile and different world wonders to improve, however the in-game purchases are really shoved in your face all the time. I have to clear 4 different "Events" every time I open the game before I can do anything.

Incredibly fun to see my game piece whipping around the board during automatic dice rolls and just constantly progressing to buy landmarks in the fun cityscapes. It seems to be a great way to pass the time in a fun monopoly nostalgic way, but of course it's not the traditional monopoly game, more like an idle clicking game that's full of monopoly fun! Just started so I'm excited to see how it will keep the fun going!

It's an ok game, but it is just a re-skin of coin master l, which makes it bad, and two things that are really annoying are 1. Every 5 seconds, there's a pop-up asking me to invite friends, and 2. Whenever I'm trying to do something, there will never be a pop-up telling me to press something, and it won't let me do/press anything else until I've done what it's told me to do.

Fun at first, the biggest issue is after people shut down/attack your board, your YOU LOSE LEVELS!! each building upgrade is already insanely expensive. You end up using all your rolls just to repair your buildings and to level them back up to where you had them before. This makes it impossible to progress to the next board or even level up!

Absolutely love this game. Certain aspects can be annoying, like the constant berage of them trying to get you to buy more dice. Easily ignorable though, game has 0 adds and there is no actual reason to purchase anything, although the rate at which you get moves back is completely ridiculous (5 per hour) it's still well worth playing.

Amazing. Really amazing, how I've deleted this game 9 times now and always end up and the same timeline of events. Randomly select the same people to play against. Win the same money and prizes at the same time on each occasion. Get stopped at the same time as well and asked for money to play on. Always spin a double when I land in jail on the second roll on levels 2 and 3 and countless other fates await me..... If I could I'd give this zero Stars! ... Seriously!

This game is so fixed! I've landed on 'go to jail" square more times in 1 day than I have in 30+ years of playing monopoly. It is statistically impossible to land on jail on almost every trip round the board in real life so it's obviously pre-programmed into the game. Definitely not a game with a true random programming and it makes game play extremely slow and tedious. Don't bother with this, there are better monopoly games out there than this fixed trash

So much wasted potential. The graphics are so good and the game runs smoothly, but the gameplay is more than underwhelming. It is basically just a copy of all the Coin Master like a lot of these games. You spin/roll to get cash to build stuff and progress through maps. Only that there is no reason to progress. It doesn't try to hide that it's a blatant cash grap with all these Pop Ups asking you to spend money for more rolls. I have expected more from a Monopoly game.

Love it. The only issue now is that I can't play the game. After the latest update, every time I load the game, it gets stuck on "shutdown." Where it's trying to load another players bank vault so I can do a heist. I have un-installed and re-installed several times. Still stuck..

The game is mindless fun. No skill or strategy needed. Just auto roll the dice and stock up on cash. But the pop-ups and ads in this game are extreme. The outer edge of the screen as 11 ad buttons, and when you run out of rolls, you get 3-5 ads pop up. Absolutely ridiculous!

Fun game. A lot of pay to win and lack of ways to earn free dice. Overall monetized in a way that doesn't hinder game play but pop-ups are annoying and seem excessive, although they're not ads they interrupt the game asking you to pay for dice and in game currency. I would recommend removing pop ups for offers and simply provide a notification button that isn't intrusive to game play.

This game got old fast. It's the same thing in every city. Literally, the same. There's really not a leveling system. The album collection rewards are basically nothing. I can tell this app was rushed by the devs. No storyline, leveling, or point to the game. On top of all that, they have the audacity to time limit with rolls. They treat the rolls like a currency. But that's how you play. Like, you want me to have a cap on how much I can play your game?

Kinda boring. Not sure what the point of this game is. Hundreds of different boards to see but you're just doing the same thing collecting money to move to the next one. Way too many options to buy in game currency, you don't need like 10 pop ups and the whole left side is nothing but clickable cash purchases.

This was described as the classic monopoly game play at a faster pace, but this is NOTHING like classic monopoly. There is no strategy, no required skill, and no sense of achievement in this seemingly never ending tap fest. A one star game but gets a second because it at least looks good and runs smoothly, if you like this sort of mindless gameplay.

Great but pushy alternative to CM or PK. Definitely more interactive than other games like this and makes you feel more involved. But otherwise very pushy when It comes to P2W packs, literally throwing everything you have at you when you run out of rolls sometimes even twice and it's extremely annoying. Not even an option to disable them.

A NEW FAVORITE! Unlike CHESS, it dose have It does have strategy which for somebody like me realy likes. I personally love a good challenge. I get distracted a lot and certain apps-(ShortAttentionSpan)-don't take all my interest but when I downloaded this app, it can help you direct how you should use your money to luck(not literally) to decision making, it gets WILD. Others see that bad in the app, I look at the good.It ALSO gives frequent update notifications and levels are easy to gain

I've been playing every day for the last 3 weeks. I enjoy the game a lot. But there are some things that frustrate me. The popups - why so many? Once is enough when we open the app. Sticker swaps less doubles! And we need a cancel button to prevent sending trades to the wrong person. And why can't there be a chat feature within the app for trading? I also don't like how limited and how expensive dice are. Value for money fail. Option to pay for 1hr of rolls would be better, more rewarding.

I played til Macabre Manor. Way too many popups about buying more rolls. Maybe once per day or once per session. But it's nonstop. On top of that, it's not like the Risk or Uno app where you can actually play your friends. Instead your friends are just targets that wouldn't even matter if they were or weren't your friend in the first place.

I just started playing yesterday and the great things I found about this game was it's fun gameplay, great graphics, how it doesn't heat my phone but that's it. I really hate how every second the pop-ups appear telling us to add friends or spend real money. On top of that the worst part of this game is the limited dice rolls. I will recommend to not play this for free in your mobile and tab and spend some money to buy the real Monopoly Board Game instead.

Pretty solid game overall. I was expecting to be playing regular Monopoly agents players but I still enjoy this type of game. The only recommendations I have is, less pop ups trying to get people to spend money, lastly a way for Free To Play Players to buy more dice rolls with the in game cash. The cash should be diverse and not limited to upgrading the board. Other than that, I love it!

Excellent game! It does remind me of BoardKings. However, I enjoy Monopolies spin on it. I find it more entertaining with Monopoly. It's my favorite board game too(so that may have a part in it). Really smooth thus far. Wishing they'd take this as a win and bring back Monopoly Hotels! I know it broke my heart when it was pulled. Anywho, great overall game.

Like others, I find this game interesting and I've enjoyed playing it, so far, apart from the popups that appear constantly - taking you out of the game. If I haven't got any rolls left, a gentle reminder is much more effective than being asked to spend money... I know Monopoly is about buying and selling, but this takes it a bit too far.

Downloaded it as soon as it got out and I'm loving it! Is a smooth game experience with everything in tune: colors, graphics, sounds and music. I'm sure it will get better :) and also, a BIG win is that it has no ads. Hope they don't add them for any reason

Yeah it's good but not that kind of better. The dice you get is limited and the boring thing is that all the goes around same. Get dice, money and upgrade the same sht everytime nothing else. I thought they would have some sort of upgrades that can help players to get more dice,money easily. I barely can play for a "long" time. Because the dice get used up quickly and the rewards are low. Also I don't understand when is the time of shutdown and bank heist. The word "fun" don't go much with game.

Very fun and fast-paced with more minigames and goals than the mainline Monopoly game. Lost two stars because of the high number of microtransactions (buy extra rolls, "Enless Abundance" where you have to keep spending to unlock more rewards, etc.) and the annoying pop-ups that promote said microtransactions.

It's abit boring, you press go and jump around the board until you land on a station, then you either match 3 or tap on a building to knock it, thats it, no competitiveness, just tap tap tap, if you want an good way to have a nap everyday then play this, I nodded off a few times, and that was when I just woke up from being in bed for 7 hours.

Lately I've been having a lot.of issues. Every 18 hrs you can collect the shop prize but it stopped allowing me. It's sitting there just saying 0 seconds and won't let me have it. I have invited friends for the reward and all 10 of them (All New To The Game) have joined but it only gave me the credit for 3 of them. I've also been having issues with the community chest only opening 3/4 friends every time and always uses the top left key to open it. It's always the same key every time.
column11: Hi there. Sorry to hear about the Free Gift and Invite Friend Milestone issue that you are having. Please contact us in-game so that we can take a look at your account and help you.

column9: There are far too many popups to make the game enjoyable. The last time I opened the app I had four popups to close before I could roll the dice five times before I had to wait another hour. The gameplay remains the same as you progress, with no real reason to spend money in the first place. The game looks nice, though.

Terrible, looks great, could be great but forced to pay way too early on in the game. The wait times are ridiculous. You can only add Facebook as a login so it's stupid. I can't add any friends as I don't have Facebook and friends seem to be a big key in progressing. Can't believe I joined the waitlist for this.

Really upset. I have been playing this game now for nearly two weeks and I have been in love with it. Spend $ 100plus on it, and until a few minutes ago I've been very satisfied. All of a sudden there was an error and it says the game needs to shut down and restart when it's shuts down and restarts all of my winnings were cut dramatically, very dramatically, ridiculously dramatically to the point I feel like it is stealing from me now.

(Played for $58 SwagBucks reward) When it comes to games that copy/paste this exact concept, of which there are many, this is by far one of the worst. The inflated prices for the buildings make for unbearably slow progression, the dice consistently landing you in between helpful spaces proves there are fixed odds for each type of space, which they are hiding, and the non-existent value in the sparse micro-transactions is just pathetic. Take a pass on this one.

It's a beautiful game, smooth gameplay nice graphics, pop up adverts after running out of dice rolls to buy more extras is annoying, but minor annoyance, just a click to close. My previous review was disappointed with the lack of dice rolls after a short while, but now I'm more into the game I'm able to gather more dice rolls through prizes, otherwise it's waiting an hour for just 5 dice rolls, which I feel could have been a bit more generous. Rating to 4 stars now after further progression.

Love the competitive edge and just the casual fast-paced gameplay. Only thing I would suggest is adding something else like a seperate minigame. The game has great replay ability thanks to the randomness of rolling but as Ive approached milestone 600, nothing is "new". Its the same grind just scaled larger. I love that sometimes if you place well in a tournament, which is rare, I let my 1500 dice rolls run on a single 1x value.

Recent app update has started to cause noticable performance issues on Android 13 on a Pixel 7 Pro. Game starts out fine but then becomes laggy and slow. The longer you attempt to play the worse it gets until you are forced to restart the app. After about 3 app restarts, it just stays laggy forcing you to restart your device. Will update this review once the proformance issues have been fixed.

The game is easy from the start but when you play along pass level 100. The game machanics pitch in and land you on land marks like jail ect to waste your dices 🎲. Dices run out way too fast and take way too long to replenish. 1 hour for 5 dices really? It's a money making game. There's nothing to keep you playing it's just frustrating. The upgrades are also way too expensive. If you have money to burn then this is the game for you.

The game can be fun. But just like others have said, THE AMOUNT OF POP UP ADDS ARE CRAZY. It's actually very, very annoying and can discourage people from playing. I get they want people to spend money on the game but people won't if they keep bombarding people with those annoying pop up offers/ads. Other than that, it can be an enjoyable game at times.

The game is fun however my landmarks get taken when i have shield (makes no sense) and an extreme fast pace game that requires pay to win in order to continue progress from friends or randoms hitting your landmarks. There's also times during railroad where the game crashes and you can't attack or your bored gets glitchy.

There is no game here, you press the same button endlessly to get money, and you spend the money on visual upgrades, rince and repeat forever, absolutely 0 interest. Add to that the INSANE amount of popups asking you to buy more rolls/money every time you do an action and a tight integration with facebook and you end up with a product that based on the other players profile pictures was clearly designed to grab as much money as possible from vulnerable senior people... SHAME

The game is fun but there are two things that is annoying. 1. It has the button to select signing in with Google play but it doesn't sign me in. 2. When you run out of dice the timer should only be like 5 minutes not a whole hour to get 5 dice. 5 every 5 minutes would be better because you don't always have the money to buy additional dices. It could possibly cause someone to not play it after the dice are used up. Please consider that.

Very Fun at the beginning, after that it's just pain. The game is very slow and very luck dependant. If you dont get any good Roll you can get stuck at a stage for weeks. Furthemore, you get stolen lots and lost of Money every half an hour or so, making it. soo damn difficult and frustraiting to even Level up a bit. Also the pop ups are very, VERY aggressive. Like every time you got no Roll you get 5 pop ups Asking you to buy more with real Money. Predatory game that gets very boring.

It's a good game, pretty fun to wreck havoc on my friend's stuff. Wish there was like power ups and stuff that i could buy to spend extra money. The pop ups to buy stuff get really annoying tho. I wish there was a way to get dice and not have to wait for forever, like make us watch ads (volunteerly) or some idk. Anyways, yeah solid game

Did a spot check: Out of 20 trips around the board I land in jail 5 times, supertax 7 times and income tax 4 times yet for comparability I only on the dark blue properties 2 times. Built in bias, clunky and errors having to double click things. It's a new app and okay at the beginning but not terribly impressed so far being nagged with popups and purchases every 5 seconds. Ludicrously expensive too, but with a name like monopoly I guess it's on brand?

Pretty pointless. It's just one of those idle click type games. Push the button, let it randomly give you stuff then tap on any building on tiny maps to upgrade them, then once they've upgraded you move to a new map. It's nothing like monopoly.

This game seems like an imitation of coin master. Coin master is better though because the expenses to build villages grow as you level up which allows you to actually make progress and have an enjoyable experience. There's no way to complete a village in a timely manner in this game because of the exorbitant prices per level as well as the very limited rewards per roll. This means that this game is a pay to win game. So why lie and have people thinking it was free. 0 stars.

I mean.. Its monopoly.. Can't really reinvent the wheel can ya. I play this every 8 hours. I'm not spending money on it like I have on games in the past to realise it really will not benefit me in the long grass.. To have 10 different little bubbles on screen followed by 5 pop ups after I run out of rolls. Eugh... But.. Its a time killer.

Touted as classic monopoly this game has a Neverending game that acts as a gatcha. You can't play with friends, or with anyone since the board is more like a world you build up than a game board. It's yours and no other characters affect you unless it's through the combat system. Attack buildings repair buildings

Almost level 500 now. Game is fun, but a wild cash grab! People that spend will quickly overtake you and waiting for dice to recharge takes a long time, especially for the cost of property building and rigged dice rolls keeping you from landing on shields. Game doesn't record when your friends sign up, even though the popup will keep asking you to invite them for rewards. Coin drop robot is rigged badly too. Glitches or jumps into worse payouts regularly

I absolutely love this game, it is amazing!! My only suggestion would be to add a (free) way to gain more roles, such as borrowing from fb friends, instead of the rolls having to be accumulated over time. Other than that, it is fun & addicting, and I will continue to play it as long as I am allowed.

It's a fun little casual tycoon like games but the game really puts spending money at the forefront of the game play. After you run out of spins you encounter 3-4 pop-ups to buy spins. I just feel too pressured to spend money in the game.

Great game. Runs smoothly and everything however if you run out of dice you have to wait a whole HOUR. If the timer was shorter like 30mins it would be more enjoyable. In addition, they should decrease the amount of times they ask to spend money. Overall, great game

Just getting annoyed with all the pop up ads. There are so many. We know where to find the store if we want to do in app purchases, it doesn't need to be in our face everytime we try to play. I don't even look at them anymore I'm to busy spaming the close button.

The game play is really fun. However, the pay to play is way out of proportion. The main feature I absolutely hate is the fact that once you achieve a higher level, you can spend all day upgrading monuments to the tune of tens of millions of dollars, just to fall alseep and be subjected to endless attacks that completely destroy all the work you did that day. Starting from zero everyday really sucks. No advancement is possible now unless you spend more and more money everyday. Fix it!

I've been playing the game for a few weeks and I have been really enjoying it. But now it keeps crashing everytime I get to the wild west stage it crashes, so I close the game and load it back up and it sends me back to the previous stage and I lose my progress ?

I absolutely love this game , but there is a bug that needs to be fixed!As I switched apponents, I loaded into the other persons board but as it was loading it was all pitch-black.Secondly,none of their buildings loaded to attack them .Thirdly the cloud which has the rich man in an aeroplane, there was a flickering cloud....

A money-grab with carefully-crafted fake RNG game. The rolls are barely true RNG, but designed to get you to a point where you would be short a few thousands to upgrade a bulding and then be out of rolls. So you either spend real money to buy more dice, or leave it there to be stolen by others in the game. There is no real strategy, other than crossing your fingers and hope that the game doesn't put you as the target. The friend system basically let them target you easier. Not enjoyable at all.

So many pop-ups. "Buy more rolls." As soon as you get into the game you have to click through 3-5 pop-ups telling you to buy dice. The UI is really slow and as soon as you finish rolling you have to click through another load of virus like pop-ups

Not a great game really not much to do but auto roll and make simple choices. You play the game for 5 minutes every 24 hours because that's all it'll let you. Biggest issue are the pop ups. I'm not paying 5 dollars to roll the dice 6 more times. Just stop every app has a cash store we know it's there no one needs constant reminders.

Cool game so far I'm loving it. Lots of fun. But I have trouble seeing what I roll on the dice half the time, there's usually one of those little characters walking through my dice. Also would be nice to be able to send messages, also instead of only getting five dice every hour we should get ten dice. And also to talk with people on my list. Just some thoughts.

If you're looking to play Monopoly, don't play this. I downloaded thinking it was just normal monopoly, but how wrong was I the entire game is just press the roll dice button and watch your character go by land on a spot get 250 bucks and upgrade your town however there are a few pros it does have a nice art style and I like how it has the same original board. Any more pros than that, and I'll be lying

It's an overall alright game, it's got a lot of shoved promotion IAP's (like the game board kings) I hope for there to be the cat token I can swap to. The attack mechanics are like coin master, but it's mostly like board kings, use spins (rolls) to travel around board by yourself, trains are used for heists. Use cash to upgrade your base and once completed, GO! To the next one. I am a long time fan of monopoly and I may just be biased... but I have hopes this app isn't just another money vacuum.

It's a good game, but the let down is the pop-ups, they are annoying and there are too many. Currently it's like 2 to 4 when you load the game, then another 2 to 4 when you run out of dice. Which personally I think is ridiculous

I know this is new, so I definitely know theres stuff to fix- but I feel like the amount of dice you get a hour is way too low especially because if you cant get shields, your properties get demolished and if too many hit one landmark you lose dots which is alot of money. I also put in a supprotticket a week ago and no one has responded. I also dont lime that you trade in 100 sticker duplicates only to get 10 dice- you should get a sticker pack with a guaranteed new one for 100 duplicates.

This game is super cute!. Only flaw is you have to wait hrs before your dice refill but over all its user easy and fun. Leveling up is so much faster than other games. Love the option of doubling up points and hitting other players buildings. You also earn dice super fast which is great.

Hi! Have you ever played coin master? Well this app is just like that, but better! You can build your cities and everything else that you do in coin master, but here, you go around a monopoly board! This is absolutely fantastic and I recommend it for anyone that loves games where you build and roll randomly! You will love this game and I know it.

New favorite Monopoly game. Similar to Monopoly Deal card game which I love. No obnoxious ads. Able to progress easily without pay to play. So far no weird glitchy bug issues. Hasbro got a solid win with this game. If I could give it more stars I would.

Excellent game but one issue just updated it and went to play loads up and allows me to tap around the board on the characters but nothing else so I've uninstalled it and reinstalling it to see if that fixes it and will let you know other than this issue it's a brill game will change rating of star once I sort the issue or have the issue fixed

1 star for developers attention. I don't always like spending money on games. This game will give you so many rolls an hour. Once you've used your rolls you either have to wait, or buy rolls. This does not keep me in game. I will move away from the game till I have more rolls. Please can you invent a way where I could exchange in game currency for rolls, or reduce the amount of time it takes to refill them. Thank you.

The game is fun and enjoyable. But the main issue is with the pop-ups every 2 seconds trying to force you to spend money. From the moment you open the app until you run out of rolls, it's just an absurd amount of pop-ups. When you think they are done, there is at least 2 more.

The game has his good points and bad points... It all depends on how you play it. Me personally I only give it to 2 Stars. A lot of ads.. it can get annoying at times... It's new so give her some time.. I made change my rating soon... The right now that is my choice..

Not worth it. Could be amazing, but all this is is collecting money, building/upgrading like the board game and moving to the next map. Consists of no actual game against anyone or even a computer. No point.

Best monopoly game ever on Android. 1 thing tho if it's not to much, could you add couple more things to the game. Such as Get out of Jail free card Add other features to it make it some what close to the actual board game. Very good work on the game loving it. Just started playing it 4/28/23 already liking it can't spot playing.

This game is rigged to the worst degree. Any time me or my wife get over 150 dice, it will not let u land on any of the railroads or any significant spot. This last one I had 223 dice and it took me around the board and never landed on anything good. It has done this multiple time. It's rigged and we are Uninstalling this game. Mind u we but a good amount of time into this game ND was actually thinking about spending money in it but not any more. Just another progression game like all the rest.

Good game. Gotta give more instead of taking tho. Def a pay to play. It would be nice if it didn't take an hour for just 5 rolls. A chat would be nice with friends. Get rid of stickers and give the PLAYERS MORE SO WE CAN PLAY. They probably wont and mess up a good thing. Making money is most important but if it's just going to be pay to play then charge for it

Nothing to do. Let me explain how this "game" works. Wait an hour for 5 seconds of play. Close a million popups every time you click anything. Receive a dozen annoying notifications every day. Then uninstall this garbage app. I just saved you a lot of time.

I've been playing this game for a few weeks now, and I have to say, it's very entertaining and addictive. Once you start rolling, you just don't feel like stopping. However, there's an opportunity to make the game even more social by introducing a chat function. This way, players can communicate with their friends and find out which sticker cards they need. That would make it easier to exchange stickers and avoid sharing duplicates without knowing if they're needed.

This game is very similar to Coin Master. It has the same exact format of building, attacking and defending your city (village). It also has a sticker (card) component similar to Coin Master. If you're looking to play the regular monopoly game this one is not for you. It is ad grr l heavy but nothing too bad All in all it's an okay game when you're bored.

What a major disappointment! As you wait a few hours in order to get more rolls, you come back to find all 5 buildings destroyed and reset and you have to grind to get them back up and then wait again, just to do it all over again. Only way to bypass is to pay for more rolls or pay for money and upgrade them all before you run out of rolls and have to wait. Don't bother downloading, you will end up uninstalling it like I just did.

Fun game but a huge problem. The dice takes an eternity to reload and there's no way of obtaining more in the meantime by watching ads or anything like that. Its so frustrating sometimes i completely forget about the game altogether because i had to wait so long to reload. Also the popups omg they are AWFUL AND ABUNDANT.

when you have a multiple on it never actually gives you the payout in dice or anything else multiplied tho it says it does. Watch when you play the pay outs are not right. Plus it's like a one time play a day game because you have to wait an hour for 5 dice rolls or pay for them. It's a fun game. Definitely a lot of things they need to fix as manufacturers of this game. adding more friends does nothing only when the game decides to give you dice you get them. FIX your game to reflect it.

This is not monopoly. If you grew up with monopoly you will hate it. Good graphics is all it has going for it. I don't know why they make a simple roll take 30 seconds of animation. Sometimes less is more. I Uninstalled it

Fun and slightly addictive. *edit* Be careful of purchases, for the most part everything goes smoothly but I tried to purchase some rolls to get higher in one of the events and it took it from my account but I never received the rolls. After the "within 24 hours" message I received and no reply I ended up going directly to Google play and requesting a refund.

I tell you WHAT GUYS, this is a GREAT APP that is Really FUN, EXCITING & BEST of ALL very ENJOYABLE to be a part of and PLAYING!!! At start-up or beginning of gameplay you're having SO MUCH FUN that you'll be outta Dice really quickly, as this happens you will think it is a Dud game and they're controlling your progress by not allowing continued gameplay. For the amount of FUN you'll have, it's ONE of the BEST GAMES I've Played in a long time HONESTLY!! Much Respect and Credit to All who DEV's..

have tried this game on 3 different devices..all 3 display a black screen and the game doesn't load. I've come to expect more from scopely so I have found this experience very disappointing. others have commented with the same problem and recieved no response, that too is disappointing.

So far, I really love the game play! I wish you could still partake in the Community chest though without having to add 5 friends because it makes me (and I'm sure many others) miss out on an aspect of gameplay.

I can't seem to take revenge on attackers, but others sure can. I am being constantly attacked by one individual player who was actually on my friends list, I removed them hoping it will help. I would like to be able to take revenge on players, I'm on android mobile if that helps. Also, It costs 3 die to roll 2 dice?..I don't understand that math

The game is very limited. Gets boring after a few days. You don't actually play monopoly at all, it's just the name. They push purchases on you aggressively, as soon as you log on or are out of rolls, the game will throw 4 or more pop ups for buying rolls and money. Also Amy money you earn is available for taking from random people. You could have 100 million and still come back to 0 next time you play. Just a cash grab, not very well thought out game.

This game is a joke. You literally don't do anything buy tap a button and even that can be skipped once you level up and unlock auto roll. This game exists solely to get money from you. There is no actual gameplay of any kind and you will be constantly given popups to spend ridiculous sums of money to continue playing. At the start, you are given 30 rolls of the dice and when you run out they want $9.99 to get more rolls or you can wait an hour for 5 rolls. Do not install....

This game is nothing but a money grab which I refuse to spend a single penny on. 4 pop ups ar the beginning and 3 more after running out of rolls is extremely annoying, and most are just HEY GIVE US MONEY type. Just let me play the damn game. Also, if you're looking for a game that plays like monopoly, this isn't it. It's not even close to the actual game. It's more about going around the board that's basically useless and robbing and destroying others property. I won't be playing this long.

Literally just started playing seems fun, but quick UI thing I think would help. When a player has enough money to upgrade a lit in a city, simply please either make the lots that are available to upgrade either have a red border, the same colour as the notification on the hammer when playing on the board, or simply reduce the size and fade the sprite for the unit achievable upgraded. Please and thank you.

The people is right this game only looks good, all you do is roll dice. It would be awesome if it were the actual monopoly game but that cost 3.99 to 4.99 good graphics but it only works a little bit, make the real monopoly game free and I might consider getting that but for now I believe I will uninstall this game.

Nothing like the actual game, all I can do is play with bots or people I've never heard of, even if you friend your friends, you still can't directly play with them. All it is is roll the die, get money, buy building and upgrade them, then on to the next map. Doing the exact same thing, just over and over again. Given I've only played for a good ten minutes, it's enough time to know that the game is just awful. Don't believe me, give it a try.

Limited play time, takes a couple of minutes to run out of dice and then several hours to get some more. You do get 6 dice generate every hour but 6 dice won't make a difference with this game. Its a pay to win game. Special events are clearly rigged. Within the first couple of minutes of an event starting, you will have someone taking top spot with a score only achievable through days of play. Clearly there's a glitch someone is taking advantage of. Stickers - too many dupes.

I was hoping for more of a classic monopoly game. What you have here is a reskin of numerous other "boardgame" based attack your friend type game. I didn't even make it through the tutorial before I uninstalled. The graphics look nice but the game itself is nothing new or exciting.

An incredibly boring grab at the monopoly franchise. All you do is click roll and get paid. That's it. No rewards. No challenge. Just click. There is an over-abundance of popups as well. The level of ads is acceptable but you'll be closing a popup every few seconds.

It's okay but need more opportunities for rolls, very difficult with the limited amount and limited opportunity to keep getting rolls. This unfortunately will lead to boredom among many people and they will eventually forget to play or whatever. Your game will fall into the same standard one time cycle of it was the greatest thing for 2 weeks. Make rolls more accessible and easier to obtain and let us keep our rolls if we get doubles :) also let us send our friends gifts and those be rolls too

I was going to delete it the day I wrote the 1st review but changed my mind because I do ❤️ Monopoly games Since I've kept playing I've shared my link to the Facebook Monopoly Go group so have added many friends and levelled up I'm enjoying it & didn't give the game a chance when I first played it. what I would like to see is a chatbox to speak and ask friends what they need without going to the Facebook Monopoly Go group page It would be easier to know what cards to send to the right friends.

The game is a lot of fun and very similar to Coin Master. My only con is waiting a full HOUR to get only 5 rolls, which I feel is kind of ridiculous. I think 10 minutes would be an ideal amount of time, but a full hour is a bit of a stretch. I understand you're using that to sell rolls, but I think that kills the game a bit.

Bugged pretty bad with the latest update. Literally nothing will load. You're also promted to make purchases 3 times at the very beginning of opening the app each time. Really really annoying. Buy something every where! Like come on.
column11: Hello there! We are sorry to hear that you're having some issues loading the game. Most performance-related issues can be resolved with some basic troubleshooting. If these steps didn't help, please contact our support team at monopoly-go-support@scopely.com so that we can better assist you.

column9: I only downloaded it to use for Mistplay when I've got all the things i need i will delete it i don't like that there are only 3 characters you can choose from i was forced to pick the boat. The buildings are over 100,000 coins.

Started off fun enough to keep my interest. Thpen came the cash-grab. Dice used too rapidly only to recover too slow. Other players have a lot of time to steal your money and destroy your board, that increasingly costs more and more to upgrade. All the while collecting shields are either over abundant or non-existant. Not enough prizes or gifts. I spend millions upon returning from a break, except this last time, I had zero money, destroyed. Very sad that I am going to delete this app.

Game runs smooth and looks good but overall its a mindless game that see you pressing 1 button (or hold to auto roll) until you run out of rolls (which will take about 30 seconds) and be bombarded with about 2/3 pop ups asking you to spend real life money to buy more rolls that will be used up in another 30 seconds and rinse and repeat. Oh, the game will also bombarded you with these real money pop ups at least 3 times as soon as you open the game. Every. single. time.

It is a really fun game! If you enjoy collection style games & miss playing monopoly then it's definitely for you, well created. I wish you were able to interact more with your monopoly board as all the people are so cute! Maybe you could make some mini games in the center to win more prizes like rolls and maybe jet out of jail free card. The only downside I have to say is that the wait time for more dice rolls is very long, I want to be playing this game more than I'm able to lol
Unskipable tutorial. Nothing irritates me more in games than that. Ridiculous amount of pop-ups when you launch. This is just an auto-roll game. No luck or skill involved, no chances.

I want a refund. I bought a purchase by accident via pressing the wrong buttons. I have applied for a refund. And instead of getting said refund, the application developers want me to file a refund request with Google play. If that's the case then I refuse to play your application. I don't want to hear some B.S. about me having to chase down more technical loophole shenanigans just so I can have my money back. Give me my refund and I'll change my review
column11: Hi there. Sorry to hear about your accidental purchase. Please kindly contact our support team in-game or at monopoly-go-support@scopely.com together with a screenshot of the transaction receipt so that we can better assist you.

column9: It's a good game, however when you land on chance and have a multipler on it will not multiply your winnings from landing on a chance space. I have been cheated out of hundreds of rolls and millions of in game dollars because of this error.

App works well and tends to run pretty smooth, my complaint how ever is this game is to much "in your face" with its own internal promos and deals, and it won't forget to remind of all of them EVERY SINGLE TIME you open the app, it very much wants you to be a "paid to play" player. Now that makes sense for a free game to do this but it's literally annoying to have them pop up everytime you open the app, run out rolls, + not much "connect" options here to cloud save

Constant repeated pop-ups asking for money... after you finished the amount of dice rolls, inundated with numerous popups asking you to buy more, at least 3 one after the other, can't see the dice roll amount of moves as it is obscured by the side buttons also demanding you buy more transactions too... greed and greed and greed. At least have an option to not show popup boxes and hide the game play board of all microtransaction request boxes

Can be mindless fun with no real purpose. That's all. Now it's heavily pay2win(like all mobile "free" games. Specially on events you don't stand a chance on winning against people who pay and have lots of dice. They get 4k points while you stand at 50-60 points. So the events are for whales. Also constantly pop ups to pay, you spend more time closing pop ups than playing XD

I do like this game, but there is a small issue, the framerate is absolutely garbage on a Samsung Galaxy S21. It goes like 30 or so FPS, and I wish there was a setting to change the graphics to make it run smoothly.

Not too sure about this game, the shop proposals are far too expensive. It feels a bit like a trap. It's pretty much mindless clicking all the time. Not like Monopoly at all. Otherwise graphics and everything is fine. Seems a shame to waste depevelopment and programming skills in this way. Is this model profitable? Do people pay those huge amounts? Don't like this model and find it abusive. Hence, 1 star. Could have made a good game with reasonable payment like the monopoly app that is paid for.

Game was a tap fest with no real strategy or anything close to monopoly classic. I understand monopoly classic already exists, but this is trash by itself. Game play loop gets as deep as tapping, and remained there. Maybe I am not the target market, hence I Uninstalled.

I love the game...it's addictive and fun. Only issues are: Dice take too long for too little, you hardly get to play! Stickers sent per day can definitely be a bit more and most of all WHY SHOULD WE NOT BE ABLE TO TRADE GOLD CARDS? It's no fun having more than one of a card you can't trade!

The game is Another Coin Master type. Accuire money, rob your friends and hinder their progress to build yours up. Progress being, upgrading themed buildings then moving onto a new theme. The game Gives the front position of Only a Facebook Log-in. If you choose Guest you can later pick Google log-in that doesn't even work. Customer support failed to help or respond in the promised time frame. Disappointed after pre-registering. Looks great, so 2 stars for the graphics and art designers work.
column11: Hi there! We would like to confirm that aside from Facebook, once you logged in to the game using a Guest account, you can also link/save your progress via Google Play through the in-game settings. Hope this helps.

column9: Fun adaptation of Monopoly to play by yourself or connect with friends. It is challenging and engaging to continue on to the next level. Great graphics and prizes!!

It's fun to play but the play time is super short and you have to wait forever to get more dice. Not a lot of opportunities to win more spins unless of course you pay for them and we all know not a lot of people will do that. Games like this where you're waiting days to play for 10 mins don't last long on my phone. Considering deleting it already.

Great casual experience, and great to share progress with friends and annoy them by stealing there monopoly cash, dont expect too much, it's all random generation and luck, very mild on the strategy side but good fun nonetheless. The pop ups are annoying but they are easily exited, with no long timed ads, only ads for in game deals. Very playable as free to play

Not as expected. Expensive in-game purchases. Very slow dice reload. Nothing like the classic Monopoly, feels more like Coin Master. Too many pop-ups. The game is extremely polished in terms of animation. It's these unnecessary stuff that steal you away from the fun.

Coinmaster but monopoly. As others have said too many pop ups, also I linked the wrong fb account and it wouldn't let me change it. I tried deleting the data/clearing the cache and reinstalling and it still didn't work. Bit odd for It to link the wrong account even on a fresh install with supposedly no data saved. Disappointed that it's another coin master clone.

Compared to other games I play, the pop up ads are relative. I accept that pop ups are the way it is. I don't agree with other reviews regarding this. In reality I think this game is quite fun & great, although if my dice runs out I wish there were more options to earn more so I can play longer.

Hello Developer I just downloaded the games and it's soo good. First of all the board work is so smooth and that's the highest highlights of the game. Never ever touch the board animation is so lovely that it keep you engaged. I played so many time in 2 days that I reached 100 level so fast . Make the money making process easy and help in creating the building of a city. Best of luck for future updates never mess with the board animation its best Regards Animesh Sharma

I like the idea of Monopoly board implemented with Coin Masters game type, nice cute graphics, runs smoothly, sure it's brainless and doesn't require any skill but some of us want that type of chill game after a hard day at work. But it's so slow. If you don't pay up for dices, good luck playing the game more than 10 minutes per day. Which is not OK. It's a pay to win basically. Even more, a pay to play. Don't pay? Don't play. Because you can't. Sadly 1 star which is about 1 star more I'd give

Don't take a concept that's being used to make dozens other games and call it monopoly, it has nothing to do with monopoly, only brainless clicking buttons and getting nowhere. I've been collecting monopoly (board) games since I was little, and this game is an insult. And it's rigged.

Graphics are nice but the game becomes really stressful after the 3 place has been finished. You can have all your money drained in a matter of hours from heists and shut downs. The prices of building increase a lot along with the amount of money you earn. But it's never enough. Unlike other games like this you don't feel rewarded for playing. But punished. The amount of pop ups you get telling you to buy stuff constantly doesn't help its case either.

Excellent graphics, but this game is nothing like the real monopoly. Can't even tell what properties you own or build your houses. The endless supply of game suggested "friends" and its unending attempts to obtain your phone and FaceBook contacts is nothing short of annoying. Been playing the game for a week and never saw a 2 or a 10 rolled yet. Scopely messed up Scrabble Go the same way.

Hooking but completely waste of time. It would be better to be able to earn rolls by playing some mini games. Now you can't get "good" in the game, the outcome of gameplay is not in your hands in any way. Also it's stupid how often it pop ups some "out of rolls" selling windows and other stuff.

Utter garbage. Game play goes... Dismiss 3 pop ups for a cash store. Click go, repeat untill you run out of dice. Of if that too demanding for you. Press and hold go untill the game plays itself. Utter utter rubbish. Uninstalling the app was the most fun part.

I don't mind the popups. Coin master is much more worst popups ever. What I really bother is , it's takes forever to wait for dice full. It's would better if you add more bonus game in order to get extra dice. The upgrade building also too expensive meanwhile the profits too low. Very fun and addictive game but......

The game has nothing to do with the actual Monopoly. It's nothing but a Coin Master clone. It gets boring quickly and, again, all it leaves is disappointment. Some features are locked behind invite-a-friend mechanic. The game is tied to facebook or legitimately phone contacts in order to even be able to play some minigames such as the community chest (which will make you lose in-game money if you dare refuse to advertise the game). A true disappointment. If you like Monopoly, avoid this game.

I would give 5 but this game isn't even worth 1 star with all the issues this game has. Not to mention having to wait 30+ mins for 5 rolls (this becomes a problem because if you want to progress at all you need to have a lot of rolls) the game is ultimately a scam to get money and if you want to save yourself some frustration don't even download. Also to add this game gets very repetitive every roll I landed on jail or something else with negative consequences that made the game not fun at all.
column11: Hi, please let us know more about this, we're not sure exactly what the issues are, please reach out in-game to Customer Service and the Team will be able to investigate and follow-up. We're sorry about any inconvenience and hope we can help with your issue(s).

column9: Simple, fun and addictive game. Can play with friends too but no other real way to interact with each other except steal money. Maybe add something in the future to play together with friends? Also, please stop with the 50 thousand pop ups... it's way too much.

Good and food but far too many notifications. LET ME TURN THEN OFF IN SETTINGS! No option at all which is annoying. Also what is a bit predatory is the buy more dices when you've gone none... yeah no thank you. I can't be affording to pay to win. Have an option to allow to disable the predatory tactic, I don't care its on the side like it is but thrown into my face is not an okay

This game is shoving pop-ups down your throat as soon as you get past the loading screen. It is constantly showing you that you can pay for more rolls with real money. The biggest problem I have with this game is that you can just purchase the money to buy building upgrades for the board. This game is a cash grab, and this model of game play should not be legal.

I do enjoy playing this game but there absolutely needs to be something done about waiting an hour for 5 dice that takes 2 seconds to use. Especially for those that don't ptp. Yes I have bought dice you still burn through them fast. At least give some free dice for watching ads or something. Also need to be able to communicate with friends in the game

Who'd have thought you could decimate a classic beyond recognition. Imagine my disappointment after waiting for the pre selected download then to find that all efforts were put into the graphics and zero effort into the gameplay. Have now ended up deleting this and the previously installed other spin off made. Such a shame.

Loving the game so far. It's like a better version of Board Kings. One thing I will say is that Doubles should give you your roll points back, unless 3 doubles are rolled, at which point you go to jail. This would be similar to classic Monopoly. I'm looking forward to seeing how the game develops.

I ❤️ LOVE it because there is no ads and it's very fun to play instead of doing it in real live because monopoly go actually can teach you but when you the game in real live then people tell you instructions and you might forget the next time you play but the more you play monopoly go the more you can learn so I give it five star 🌟 rating

I like it so far except it needs a communication service to chat w friends & talk trash w to be more competitive that's w was fun about old school monopoly talking trash & making the most outrageous deals to setup other players. Also toooo many pop-ups I get it that's how they make there money or whatever but cmon ppls would like & dload the gm if not soooooo many ads & not soooo repetitive. Also the fact I have to pay money to add more dice rolls after I run out is micrtransaction robery

Its a really good game would recommend to people who like a simple but very well built game. I liked it because there are basically no ads maybe one every 10 minutes but all in all great game for people who also just want to play monopoly for the first time or even for a quick dice roll or buy something with in-game money. I've sayed this twice ill say it again great game keep up the hard work.

Bad. I got blue fully upg with hotels, Soon as I landed on it I lost it due to "colour set complete". Which is an really annoying feature Especially for the blues. Don't play. Honestly the wheel for it isn't even worth it! I'd rather keep the rent for that space.

I don't know why I would play Monopoly Go over Board Kings, the game they quite literally just ripped off. Except it doesn't even have the charm of Board Kings because that game at least has the boards substantially change, this just occasionally recolor a Monopoly Board. The pop ups are unbearable, the pace is boring and if you want access to the community chest (which is not in any way worth it but does take up 2 spaces on the board) you have to convince people to play this game. Bad game.

I love this game but PLEASE stop hitting us with three pop ups after we run out of rolls. Auto roll x10, left with four rolls = 3 store pop ups. Roll x3, left with one roll = 3 store pop ups. Roll last roll and surprise! 3 store pop ups. That's 9 store ads within about 30 seconds. Not including getting hit with them when we log in, move levels, or other reasons. I'm about to uninstall just based on your in game store. I definitely am not inclined to spend money on such a needy game.

Very polished game. Looks really nice and plays pretty great for the first hour. Constantly bombarding you with things to do, more dice rolls, more money, lots of level ups. Soon however you reach a point where you can do nothing but wait or pay. Leave for a while and come back later for more play time.

The microtransactions are CRAZY. Not a terrible game graphic wise, but the constant requests to spend money are over the top. For example, upon logging in, you're greeted with 3 offers to spend money immediately before even seeing the board. No real strategy, just mindless rolling out dice. Purely a money grab of an app.

Edit: Decided to reopen the game to see if I could enjoy it, I had to close 8 pop-ups just to hit jail, community chest, pay a luxutax, land on a small spot, then pay into CC AGAIN. It's an insanely generic game. With way to many pop up "buy this bundle " 3 pop ups every time you switch screens. Boring type of fun with no reward. You roll, get money, upgrade houses that mean nothing, pick a spot to attack in a mini game (shows FB friends that don't play the game). Just an absolute waste of time

Fun, but way too many pop ups. The game experience is overall very fun and engaging, yet the instant you run out of rolls; a barrage of pop up deals appears. It's honestly fun, but the barrage of pop ups for micro transactions makes me lose interest after a bit.

A simple board rolling game that you don't have to pay for to feel like you are advancing, ads are not intrusive but in app purchase pop-ups are, when you open the app there are about 3 in a row you have to get past to actually start playing. Time locked rolls is a downside but that's expected in this day and age.

After getting to a certain level I try to go on the game and it gets to 33 percent loaded and says I have no internet connection. Even though I know I do because I can go on the web like YouTube Facebook and any other places that require internet. I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling and it made me start over but it would let me play and then whenever I go to log into Facebook and use my save game it gets to 33 percent and won't let me play. It needs to be fixed.
column11: Hello! We are sorry to hear about your gaming experience. This was an issue affecting many players and our game team already managed to resolve

column9: Not really Monopoly. Yes, the classic board is here as well as Mr. Monopoly but that's where the similarities end. This is basically a modified Piggy Go where you build cities and attack and steal from other players. Boring!
